humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 3 x 3.3 x 2.1 cm for the invasive ductal carcinoma. According to the rules, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The given tumor size falls within this range, so the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the tumor is described as 'Lesion sized 3 x 3.3 x 2.1 cm'. The greatest dimension of the tumor is 3 cm. Therefore, the T stage is T2, as T1 is for tumors that are 2 cm or less in size, and T3 is for tumors that are larger than 5 cm. T4 refers to tumors of any size that have grown into the chest wall or skin.
